2023-05-07T21:27:27Z: Until then, ciao for now, enjoy the rest of your Sunday and go well!
2023-05-07T21:26:45Z: With that, we'll call time on our live coverage of the Miami GP. We have a short break before the next race, the Emilia Romagna GP at Imola on 19-21 May, which starts a triple-header of races with Monaco and Spain.
2023-05-07T21:23:20Z: The trophies, winners' medal and champagne is shared out and the celebrations truly get going! Red Bull utterly dominant once again, can anyone catch them?
2023-05-07T21:20:35Z:
Here's the full race report:https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-miami-gp-race-report/10466658/
    
Max Verstappen, Red Bull Racing RB19, Kevin Magnussen, Haas VF-23
Photo by: Steven Tee / Motorsport Images
2023-05-07T21:19:19Z: After a bit of a wait, Verstappen, Perez and Alonso are on the podium. Time for the Dutch and Austrian national anthems.
2023-05-07T21:16:41Z: The trio have made it to the podium greenroom, equipped with a locker room-style display for the top three.
2023-05-07T21:15:24Z: Verstappen's win and fastest lap sees him extend his championship lead to 14 points over Perez, with Alonso in third already 44 points off the Dutchman.
2023-05-07T21:13:16Z: The podium trio have been put into some mini cars, beeping their way through the stadium to get to the rostrum. Miami is doing Miami things again.
2023-05-07T21:06:45Z: Perhaps even more surprising was there wasn't a single safety car or yellow flag to speak of all race. Some very well behaved drivers in Miami.
2023-05-07T21:05:07Z: Tsunoda finishes 11th, fending off Stroll at the finish line, with Bottas fading to 13th. Albon comes home in 14th ahead of Hulkenberg, Zhou, Norris, de Vries, Piastri and Sargeant. All 20 starters finished.
2023-05-07T21:03:45Z: Hamilton takes sixth ahead of Leclerc, Gasly, Ocon and Magnussen who grabs the final points-paying place.
2023-05-07T21:02:51Z: Alonso rounds out the podium in third place, ahead of Russell and Sainz, who keeps fifth despite his five-second penalty.
2023-05-07T21:01:45Z: Verstappen wins the Miami GP! Perez completes a Red Bull 1-2!
2023-05-07T21:00:27Z: On to the final lap, and that looks like your lot. Final orders at the bar, please.
2023-05-07T20:59:36Z: Verstappen's got the fastest lap in his pocket and has a 3.8s lead over Perez. It didn't go to plan in qualifying, but he's been flawless in the grand prix.
2023-05-07T20:58:48Z: Tsunoda is 3.1s behind Magnussen now, with the Haas driver likely to hold that final point providing he can have a clean final couple of laps.
2023-05-07T20:58:06Z: Hamilton has marched his way into the top six ahead of Leclerc into Turn 11.
2023-05-07T20:57:33Z: Aww, poor Russell. He spotted a car in front of Alonso and thought it was Perez, but is told it is the lapped car of Sargeant. Oh dear.
2023-05-07T20:56:12Z: And Hamilton also gets by Gasly to take seventh place at Turn 11 to continue his chase of Leclerc.
2023-05-07T20:55:35Z: Leclerc duly darts by Gasly for sixth into Turn 1, but their fight as invited Hamilton into the mix.
2023-05-07T20:55:20Z: In that battle for the final point, Tsunoda is now 3.9s behind Magnussen on lap 53 of 57.
2023-05-07T20:54:07Z: As the strategies have all shaken out the top five are fairly spread out right now. Leclerc is within DRS range of Gasly in the fight for sixth.
2023-05-07T20:52:25Z: Tsunoda takes Bottas for 11th. He's got five seconds to close to get a point out of this afternoon.
2023-05-07T20:52:15Z: Alonso, clearly bored and lonely in third place, is watching the big screens to see team-mate Stroll's pass on Albon for 13th place.
2023-05-07T20:51:27Z: Into the closing stages of this race, it was a solid effort by Perez but Verstappen has been unstoppable this afternoon. He may have to settle for second place as the gap grows to 1.8s.
2023-05-07T20:49:12Z: Albon is losing ground. Tsunoda has just passed him for 12th, with Stroll relegating the Williams to 14th.
2023-05-07T20:48:54Z: Game, set and match? Verstappen's next lap is a 1m30.637s to pull out his lead over Perez to 1.5s.
2023-05-07T20:47:26Z: Perez defends well into Turn 17, but Verstappen has a second go at him into Turn 1, they go side-by-side at the exit of the corner but Verstappen gets ahead and regains the lead!
2023-05-07T20:46:21Z: It's all pretty stagnant outside of the top six, with Leclerc 1.9s behind Gasly. Hamilton sits eighth, Magnussen ninth and Ocon 10th.
2023-05-07T20:45:23Z: Verstappen, on fresh mediums, will make light work of this against Perez given he's also got DRS.
2023-05-07T20:44:21Z: A 3.1s pitstop for Verstappen and he comes out in second place about 1.5s back.
2023-05-07T20:43:30Z: Stroll goes fastest with a 1m30.682s in 15th on his fresh mediums.
2023-05-07T20:43:21Z: Verstappen pits from the lead with an 18.3s gap over Perez. Here we go...
2023-05-07T20:42:55Z: Perez has realised what's going on and is picking up the pace. He puts in a 1m30.897s, a new fastest lap, which gives him two-tenths back on the gap to Verstappen.
2023-05-07T20:39:57Z: Stroll is the penultimate driver to stop as he goes onto mediums. He is out again in 15th.
2023-05-07T20:38:02Z: Verstappen's 1m31.0s gives him another half a second on Perez to get the gap to 18.2s. If he keeps going at this rate he might even come out ahead of the Mexican.
2023-05-07T20:36:44Z: Verstappen's lead is up to 17.6s as Perez is starting to struggle with the pace and making a few mistakes.
2023-05-07T20:35:36Z: In fact, that move was timely indeed for Hamilton as Ocon slotted in between the Mercedes and Bottas at the start of lap 40.
2023-05-07T20:35:14Z: Hamilton gets through on Bottas on the inside of Turn 16 to take 10th as Ocon heads for the pits.
2023-05-07T20:34:47Z: Leclerc has also finally cleared Magnussen for ninth.
2023-05-07T20:34:33Z: Hamilton has dispatched with Albon and is now hounding old team-mate Bottas.
2023-05-07T20:34:13Z: Hulkenberg fires in the fastest lap of the race on fresh medium tyres with a 1m30.901s.
2023-05-07T20:34:05Z: Now it is Verstappen's turn to pull on the rope between the Red Bulls, pushing the gap to 16.9s over Perez. All eyes are turning to the Red Bull pits.
2023-05-07T20:32:15Z: Hamilton has come in for his stop on lap 38 to switch to medium tyres. The Mercedes driver comes back out in 13th behind Albon.
2023-05-07T20:31:44Z: Russell is on a right old charge as he storms by Sainz into fourth place. This is turning into a nightmare race for Ferrari.
2023-05-07T20:30:48Z: Leclerc uses DRS to outbrake Magnussen into Turn 17, but loses out into Turn 1 and is relegated to 11th as Tsunoda dives into pitlane for his stop.
2023-05-07T20:30:19Z: Perez puts in a 1m31.192s to chip a couple of tenths into Verstappen's lead. The gap is at 15.6s.
2023-05-07T20:29:42Z: Magnussen had a brief off-track moment at the Turn 14/15 chicane but holds 11th. He's got Leclerc bearing down on him now.
2023-05-07T20:28:47Z: Verstappen and Perez are still matching lap times out in front, which is pushing the pair clear of the rest of the pack headed by Alonso in third.
2023-05-07T20:27:10Z: Hmm, Sainz had briefly slipped behind Ocon, but has got back ahead again into Turn 11.
2023-05-07T20:26:10Z: Hulkenberg finally comes into the pits. He goes onto the mediums and rejoins in 16th.
2023-05-07T20:25:00Z: Perez is keeping an eye on Verstappen's pace as he puts in a lap just a shade slower. Red Bull expects Verstappen to come out around 5s behind Perez when he does pit.
2023-05-07T20:23:51Z: Verstappen duly reacts with a 1m31.293s to set a new fastest lap of the race.
2023-05-07T20:23:21Z: Zhou has come in for a new set of hard tyres, dropping him to 17th between Norris and De Vries.
2023-05-07T20:20:57Z: Just like Alonso, Sainz darts by Ocon into Turn 11 to take the position to move into fourth.
2023-05-07T20:20:12Z: McLaren is having a shocker this afternoon. Piastri is battling a long brake pedal in 18th, 11.5s behind team-mate Norris.
2023-05-07T20:18:59Z: Alonso, with the aid of DRS again, takes third place on the track by passing Ocon at Turn 11.
2023-05-07T20:18:20Z: At the front, Verstappen and Perez are running a similar pace, with the gap at 16.1s. The Dutch driver will lose around 20s in his pitstop and then will attack on fresh medium tyres.
2023-05-07T20:17:27Z: Russell eases past Hulkenberg into Turn 11 for seventh as the Haas is yet to change tyres.
2023-05-07T20:16:39Z: Next time around Alonso gets the move done at Turn 11, taking fourth place off Sainz, which will be the final podium place when Ocon pits ahead.
2023-05-07T20:15:53Z: As I say that, Leclerc has found a way through on Zhou for 13th.
2023-05-07T20:15:35Z: Leclerc hasn't been able to do much to work his way through cars in front of him following his stop. The Ferrari is still 14th but has DRS range on Zhou.
2023-05-07T20:15:11Z: Alonso, with a seven-lap tyre life advantage over Sainz, wants to take the place on track rather than rely on the penalty. He gets very close to the rear of Sainz into Turn 11 but has to back out of it.
2023-05-07T20:14:44Z: Stroll not happy with the amount of information he is being given by his team. He's told his pace is good.
2023-05-07T20:13:22Z: Stroll has now dropped out of the points as Gasly came past into Turn 11. Remember, Stroll is yet to stop.
2023-05-07T20:12:31Z: Alonso pits at the end of lap 24 from second and comes out in fifth, behind Sainz, but his Ferrari rival has that five-second penalty to serve which will undo all his good work.
2023-05-07T20:11:31Z: No further action from the stewards on the Stroll incident.
2023-05-07T20:11:18Z: Mercedes reassures Russell that his front wing is ok. Certainly doesn't look like he's struggling with any issues.
2023-05-07T20:10:41Z: Russell eases past Stroll into Turn 1 for ninth at the start of lap 24. The Aston driver has been noted for leaving the track and gaining an advantage at some point over the previous lap.
2023-05-07T20:10:35Z: Red Bull boss Horner says the team's simulation tools predict Perez and Verstappen to be battling for the lead with three laps to go. That'll be fun.
2023-05-07T20:08:59Z: Albon comes into switch to the hard tyre, leaving Alonso as the only driver on mediums right now on lap 23.
2023-05-07T20:08:50Z: And yep, Sainz is in trouble. He's been given a five-second penalty for speeding in the pitlane. That'll wreck his race.
2023-05-07T20:08:15Z: Perez, on his fresh hards, makes light work of taking third place at Turn 11 off Ocon who is yet to pit.
2023-05-07T20:07:52Z: Nice fight for ninth between Albon and Stroll, with the Williams holding the position on his medium tyres.
2023-05-07T20:07:06Z: Sainz dives by Hulkenberg for fifth at Turn 1, but bad news might be coming for the Spaniard. He is noted for potentially speeding in the pitlane. He locked up horribly coming into the pitlane, so where there is (tyre) smoke, there's fire...
2023-05-07T20:06:42Z: Russell is closing on Stroll, who is yet to stop, for 10th, with Zhou, Gasly, Magnussen, Leclerc and Bottas behind.
2023-05-07T20:05:39Z: At the end of lap 20 Perez pits from the lead. It is a decent stop, 2.2s, and he comes out in fourth place.
2023-05-07T20:04:17Z: Verstappen takes another half a second out of Perez's lead, whose medium tyres are really starting to cry enough.
2023-05-07T20:03:38Z: Sainz managed to get out just in front of Albon, which is a crucial element in Ferrari's hopes of undercutting Alonso and Aston Martin.
2023-05-07T20:02:55Z: Stroll has moved up to 10th after passing Zhou into Turn 1. Those two, Tsunoda and Albon ahead have yet to stop.
2023-05-07T20:02:44Z: Sainz has a huge lock-up diving into the pits, swapping his mediums for hards, and comes out in seventh.
2023-05-07T20:02:10Z: After his stop, Russell is 12th from Gasly, Magnussen, Leclerc and Bottas.
2023-05-07T20:01:51Z: Verstappen is reeling in Perez with the gap down to 2.2s.
2023-05-07T20:00:54Z: Russell pits from fifth place on lap 18 having been tucked up behind Sainz.
2023-05-07T20:00:09Z: Magnussen has found himself with a good opportunity here. He's just over a second behind Gasly after their respective stops. Both sitting 15th and 14th at the moment on lap 17.
2023-05-07T19:59:02Z: So, Red Bull vs Red Bull at the front. 3.0s is the gap at the end of lap 16.
2023-05-07T19:58:47Z: Hamilton's overtake on Albon was a straightforward draft past on the straights before he got to the braking zone for Turn 11.
2023-05-07T19:58:03Z: Gasly and Bottas have pitted. De Vries has also been in. All onto the hard tyres now.
2023-05-07T19:57:08Z: On lap 15 Verstappen darts by Alonso to take second place at Turn 11, in a carbon copy of his move on Sainz the lap before. That Red Bull is rapid.
2023-05-07T19:56:26Z: A pitstop for Magnussen for hard tyres finally sees Hamilton gain a place, but only to 12th.
2023-05-07T19:56:06Z: Not a lot of movement going on outside of the top 10. Hamilton is still stuck in 13th. He's well within DRS range of Albon, but that Williams is very slippery on the straights.
2023-05-07T19:55:33Z: Verstappen sets another new fastest lap and having sized up Sainz he makes his move at Turn 11 to take third place.
2023-05-07T19:53:58Z: Magnussen defended well at Turn 11 to keep Leclerc at bay, but this feels like a matter of when not if.
2023-05-07T19:53:21Z: Leclerc tried to take seventh from Magnussen at the first turn, but ran deep and let the Haas back through. Ocon looks menacing behind this pair.
2023-05-07T19:52:37Z: Perez and Verstappen are trading fastest lap times, with the Mexican's lead over Alonso up to 2.7s, while the Dutch driver is closing up on Sainz in third.
2023-05-07T19:50:43Z: A quick look behind the top six, Magnussen is now within DRS range of Leclerc, with Ocon also in this mix. Bottas is a couple of seconds back in 10th.
2023-05-07T19:49:52Z: So, 10 laps in and Verstappen has gone from ninth to fourth, but more importantly, he is only 4.8s off Perez in the lead.
2023-05-07T19:48:47Z: A lap later, Verstappen repeats the trick on Gasly to take fourth place at Turn 17, showing the French driver the outside wall as he does it. Russell joins the action, taking the opportunity to charge into the inside of Gasly at Turn 1.
2023-05-07T19:46:56Z: Verstappen dives by Russell into Turn 17 and takes fifth place. Good move, that.
2023-05-07T19:46:34Z: Hulkenberg tried an overtake on Bottas for 10th at Turn 1 at the start of lap eight, but locked up and ran wide, keeping Bottas in position.
2023-05-07T19:45:48Z: Verstappen is still the fastest driver on track, last time around putting in a 1m32.555s, which is three-tenths faster than Perez leading the race.
2023-05-07T19:44:01Z: Ocon had a moment at the Turn 14/15 chicane, running through the corner. He's 0.5s behind Leclerc in their battle for eighth on lap seven.
2023-05-07T19:43:15Z: Verstappen is in DRS range of Russell now - he's a comin' and comin' fast.
2023-05-07T19:42:38Z: Norris' McLaren team-mate Piastri has also come in for hard tyres at the end of lap five.
2023-05-07T19:42:23Z: Perez will know he needs to get as far up the road as possible from his team-mate, with four drivers between the Red Bull pair. The Mexican leads by 2s from Alonso six laps in.
2023-05-07T19:42:03Z: Norris has been into the pits to ditch his soft rubber for hards. Not the quickest of stops for the McLaren.
2023-05-07T19:41:17Z: A replay of the first lap showed De Vries running into the back of Norris into the first corner after the AlphaTauri driver locked up. Hamilton also had a nudge with Hulkenberg at the start.
2023-05-07T19:41:13Z: Verstappen sets a new fastest lap, going a tenth quicker than Perez out in front, despite being on the harder and slower tyres.
2023-05-07T19:40:34Z: Hamilton has made no inroads on 13th on the hard tyres.
2023-05-07T19:40:08Z: Ocon returns to 10th with a pass on Hulkenberg into Turn 11.
2023-05-07T19:40:01Z: Alonso is responding to Perez's early pace, keeping the gap stable now, which is bringing along Sainz, Gasly and Russell with them.
2023-05-07T19:39:06Z: Verstappen slingshots past both Leclerc and Magnussen into Turn 1 after a great launch out of the last turn. He is up to sixth!
2023-05-07T19:38:35Z: Verstappen has all of a sudden found himself on the rear of Leclerc after Magnussen passed the Ferrari.
2023-05-07T19:38:08Z: Sargeant is having his front wing changed too having picked up some damage in those opening tours. Not sure yet where he has done that.
2023-05-07T19:37:41Z: Sargeant has come into the pits at the end of lap two for a switch onto the hard tyres.
2023-05-07T19:37:29Z: Perez is bolting off at the front, pulling a 1.2s lead at the end of lap 2, so he is out of DRS range from Alonso when it is enabled.
2023-05-07T19:36:59Z: Verstappen has passed Bottas for eighth now. The Red Bull is on the hard tyres, with every driver in front of him on mediums.
2023-05-07T19:36:23Z: Hamilton hasn't made up ground from 13th.
2023-05-07T19:36:10Z: It is a pretty clean opening lap all around, as Russell and Leclerc also get ahead of Magnussen to push the Dane back to seventh.
2023-05-07T19:35:27Z: Bad start for Verstappen. He lost one spot off the line to Ocon, but snatched ninth back with a daring move into Turn 12.
2023-05-07T19:34:50Z: Perez keeps his lead into Turn 1 ahead of Alonso, Sainz and Gasly who gets ahead of Magnussen.
2023-05-07T19:33:26Z: It is a very slow formation lap led by Perez, but he is finally lining the pack up on the starting grid. We are moments away from the race start...
2023-05-07T19:30:57Z: The formation lap is under way, all 20 drivers away smoothly, so here we go.
2023-05-07T19:30:10Z: So, in short, the top seven start on the mediums, then a pair of hards in Ocon and Verstappen right behind them.
2023-05-07T19:28:57Z: Tyre news: It is quite a spread. Ocon, Verstappen, Hulkenberg, Hamilton Zhou, Tsunoda and Stroll all start on hards. Norris and Piastri start on softs. The rest are on mediums.
2023-05-07T19:27:43Z: The drivers are in their cars, so just time for any final predictions. Can Perez win from pole or will Verstappen and company come charging through the pack?
2023-05-07T19:22:54Z: Assuming it stays dry, this should be a simple one-stopper for the majority, starting on mediums and switching to the hards to go to the end. But safety cars, red flags and strategy gambles could offer opportunities.
2023-05-07T19:19:44Z: After celeb spotting, driver presentations and the US national anthem, it is easy to forget there is a race about to start. Just 10 minutes to go until lights out.
2023-05-07T19:17:43Z: Now the US anthem is sung by Gale. It appears to be blowing a Gale on the grid, too.
2023-05-07T19:13:29Z: Remember when Michael Buffer did the driver introductions at the 2017 US GP? Yeah, that. But at least this time the names of the drivers are being pronounced correctly.
2023-05-07T19:09:41Z: Will.i.am is now conducting an orchestra on the grid before the drivers are introduced on the grid by LL Cool J. That's F1 in 2023.
2023-05-07T19:07:29Z: Andretti is on the F1 grid... well Michael Andretti is. He's aiming to get a new team in the championship by 2025 with backing from Cadillac.
2023-05-07T19:03:30Z: Just under 30 minutes to go until the race starts. Between now and then F1 is going to be Miami-ised.
2023-05-07T18:54:40Z: The weather looks set to play a role in this race, one way or the other, given it is hot and humid. Add to that it is very windy and some dark clouds overhead look threatening, so that'll add some spice. There was also heavy rain overnight which has washed away rubber laid down.
2023-05-07T18:50:25Z: All 20 drivers have safely made it to the grid and, what feels like a novelty these days, every driver is starting where they qualified - no grid penalties or pitlane starts or spin around three times and go.
2023-05-07T18:48:08Z: A quick reminder that F1 tweaked its grid procedures to allow cars to get to the grid 10 minutes earlier than previous, to make time for more grid activities. We've been lucky enough to get a taster of them... you won't want to miss it.
2023-05-07T18:41:34Z: Hello one and all! The scene is set for a very intriguing Miami GP - the cars are leaving the pits and on the way to the grid.
